description.zh: 瞭解組合邏輯與序向邏輯電路之分析，設計及簡化之方法，內容包含：１.數系：數位系統所使用之各種數系及其轉換之方法２.布氏代數：了解布氏代數的基本運算法和定律，及認識基本邏輯   及邏輯閘３.布氏代數之簡化：介紹各種布氏代數之簡化方法４.組合邏輯：據布氏代數及邏輯閘，計分析各種組合邏輯電路５.可程式邏輯陣列：介紹ＰＬＡ，ＰＡＬ，ＦＰＧＡ等之設計方法６.正反器：介紹各種正反器電路及了解其基特性７.同步與非同步序向電路：介紹各種同步與非同步序向電路分析與   設計之方法 ８.遞迴網路：介紹遞迴網路之設計方法９.ＶＨＤＬ：介紹如何使用ＶＨＤＬ語言設計數位電路
description.en: The course covers the analysis,design and simplification of bath combinational and sequential systems.Contents include:1.Number systems and codes2.Booolean algebra3.Simplification of Boolean algebra4.Combinational logic5.Programmable logic array6.Flip-flops7.Synchronous and asynchronous sequential circuits8.Recursive networks9.VHDL

description.zh: 瞭解各種數位邏輯閘，基本數位電路之特性及設計和應用，內容包含：1.TTL，CMOS邏輯閘之特性實習，2.組合邏輯電路設計實習含：算術電路，比較器，解碼器，編碼器，多工器，解多工器等，3.序向邏輯電路設計實習含：正反器，計數器，記錄器，及移位暫存器等，.D/A和A/D之轉換實習，5.利用ASM圖之電路設計實習，6.PLD設計實習，7.ORCAD/VST，PSPICE數位電路模擬實習，8.專題實作。
description.en: Experiments with various logic gates and basic digital circuits.Contents include:1.TTL and CMOS lab.2.Combinational logic circuit design lab.3.Sequential logic circuit design lab.4.D/A and A/D converters lab.5.PLD design lab.6.Digital circuit design lab.7.Special projects.

description.zh: 線性代數為工程類學科之基礎數學之一,著重於訓練學生矩陣運算及基本數學証明.課程大綱如下：1.解聯立方程式2.矩陣運算3.行列式4.向量空間5.線性轉換6.特徵值及特徵向量7.選擇性題材,視時間充許教授下列之一：矩陣數值方法, Jordan form ,或線性規劃
description.en: As a basic mathematics in engineering,the course Linear Algebraemphasizes on the subjest of matrix computation(theory) and thetechnique of mathematical proving.The outline of the course includes the following:1.Systems of Linear Equations2.Matrices3.Determinants4.Vector Spaces5.Linear Transformations6.Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors7.Advanced Topics: selet one of the following if time permitted:  Numerical Techniques in Matrix operations,Jordan form,or     Linear Programming.

description.zh: 本校體育課程目標為鍛鍊健全身心、促進身心健全發展、培養運動道德、發揚團隊精神及養成終身運動習慣。四技一年級實施普通班體育正課教學。四技二、三年級實施專項分組教學，由具有專長之教師授課。開課項目：籃球、排球、桌球、羽球、保齡球、射箭、高爾夫球、網球、體操遊戲、慢速壘球、太極拳、國際標準舞、體適能、國術。學生得按自己興趣選擇修習。本校體育課程目標為鍛鍊健全身心、促進身心健全發展、培養運動道德、發揚團隊精神及養成終身運動習慣。四技一年級實施普通班體育正課教學。四技二、三年級實施專項分組教學，由具有專長之教師授課。開課項目：籃球、排球、桌球、羽球、保齡球、射箭、高爾夫球、網球、體操遊戲、慢速壘球、太極拳、國際標準舞、體適能、國術。學生得按自己興趣選擇修習。
description.en: All students are required to attend two hours per week of Physical Education class. This requirement applies to Freshman Sophomore and Junior students while it is an elective for senior students.  For Freshman level, Classes focus on basic physical strength training.  For Sophomore and Junior students, classes are interest-oriented, thus giving students the opportunity to select specific activities they are interested in.  Choices include Basketball, Volleyball, Table Tennis, Badminton, Bowling, Archery, Golf, Tennis, Gymnastics, Slow pitch, Tai Chi Chuan, Ballroom Dancing, Physical Fitness and martial arts, to mention a few.

description.zh: 課程重點：(1)藉由適合其程度的教材加強學生必備的基礎文法觀念和句型結構；(2)使學生確切把握閱讀要領以及充分瞭解寫作的各種技巧，重心在生字、片語、句法的解釋和基本寫作技巧的分析；(3)熟悉英語人士日常生活情境及與學生將來就業環境相關之會話及適當之應對方式；(4)透過練習加強聽、說、讀、寫的知能及表達。
description.en: This course is designed (1) to strengthen students' previously required knowledge in English with basic grammatical ideas and sentence patterns reviewed through reading materials appropriate to their levels; (2) to develop reading skill by giving explanation of difficult words, phrases, and syntax, as well as analysis of basic writing skill; (3)to  familiarize students with useful expressions in conversation and build up their confidence in cross-cultural communication; (4)to reinforce the competence and performance of listening, speaking, reading and writing by practice.

description.zh: 國文，是運用本國語言文字，蘊釀於欣賞文藝作品，充實文化內涵，增進思維能力與人文素養的一門課程。本課程分為大一上學期2學分，大一下學期2學分。大一上學期的授課內容，以文學名篇為範圍；希望藉此擴建學生深入品味文學趣味的能力，鍛鍊靈活的語文敏感度，默契文學創意，甚而嘗試創作。大一下學期的授課內容，以思想名篇為範圍；希望藉此啟發學生透轍分析各家學說思想，漫步哲人的宇宙天地，跟隨哲人的心路歷程，進而念茲在茲，從容內化，共饗取之不盡用之不竭的先驗與風範。
description.en: "Chinese" is the course where we make full use of our native languages to enjoy literary works, to enrich our cultural taste, to develop our thinking and even to elevate human cultivation.This four-credit course is set for the freshman students: with 2 credits in each of the two semesters of the school year. In the first semester, the course covers important articles in literature, in the hope for the student learners to cultivate better ability to taste literary works when they have more vivid sense on the language. With fuller knowledge on what literature is about, they are expected to try creative writings. For the second semester, the course is mainly focused on the writings on thoughts. It is our expectation that throughout the reading and analysis of various great schools of philosophy, the student learners are given the opportunity to explore the huge minds of philosophers, who will thus be imitated and followed. name.en: Core Curriculum of Liberal Arts Education：Culture

description.zh: 本課程旨在提昇學生的人文素養。透過文學概論、藝術概論與文化概論等相關課程，引導學生探索文學的妙趣，欣賞藝術的美質，瞭解文化的傳統。從古典到現代，從本土到世界，從物質到心靈，建構多元化的文化視野。以臺灣為出發點，搜尋未知的世界地圖，找到人們必然駐足的角落，以及自己不可缺席的人文風景。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to enrich the literary taste and the cultural cultivation of our students. Though the related course, like Introduction of Literature, Introduction of Art and Introduction of Culture, we hope to guide the students to explore the interest of the Literature, to enjoy the beauty of the Art and to understand the tradition of the Culture. From classic to modern, from local to universe, from material to spirit, we want to construct multiple cultural views. Taking Taiwan as a start, we would search the unknown map of the universe, and would find a corner for consequential staying and one's own liberal scenery.

name.en: Core Curriculum of Liberal Arts Education：History

description.zh: 本課程主要是讓學生對歷史這門學科有一通盤、系統的認識，以便讓學生瞭解歷史的思維取向，增加個人的歷史意識。並在歷史學門的領域中，提供數門基礎及進階課程，供同學選修，以期同學從課程的學習中，理解台灣、中國乃至世界文明的進程與發展，剖析歷史學與現實的互動，提昇學生批判思考之能力。
description.en: This course focuses on getting the students familiar with the academic field of history in a more comprehensive and systematic view. The students are stimulated to think and make judgment with a view to "knowing the history," adding to a better sense of history. Further, they are guided to select some  courses in the field of history, including the formation and changes of the of Taiwan China and the World-as well as interactions between history and the reality-thus enhancing their critical ability to think and judge.

description.zh: 本課程希望在一學年中，能使學生對微分及積分有充分的瞭解、培養邏輯推理、啟發思考創造、強化計算演繹並注重應用與作圖，以建立同學未來學習工程數學及相關專業課程之數學基礎，充分達到學以致用的目的。課程內容包括：1.極限與連續，2.導數及其應用，3.不定積分與定積分，4.超越函數及其反函數，5.積分法則，6.不定型與瑕積分，7.定積分的應用，8.空間幾何與向量微積分，9.偏導數，10.重積分。
description.en: This course aims at developing comprehension of Derivation and Integral、activating capabilities of Logic Inference and Induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The content includes: 1.Limits and Continuity, 2.Derivative and Application, 3.Indefinite and Definite Integral, 4.Transcendental Functions and their Inverses, 5.Techniques of Integration, 6.Indeterminate Forms and Improper Integral, 7.Application of Integration, 8.Basic Vector Analysis, 9.Partial Derivative, 10.Multiple Integration.

description.zh: 本課程之目的在於教導學生能夠以線性代數中所提供之各種方法來求解線性連立方程組，並奠定研習線型規畫，作業研究，等課程之基礎。由於本系分兩組教學，因應之課程內容分別為：管理組：矩陣、方程式之解、行列式、向量、微分方程式及應用問題等。工程組：矩陣方程式之解、行列式、向量及向量空間等。
description.en: The objective of this course is to introduce the linear algebra by using several different methods to solve the linear dependent equations and to build up the fundamental knowledge of linear programming and Operation Research. Two groups instruct the contents of this course. For the engineering group the array, solution of combinatory equations, vectors, differential equations and its implementation are included. For the management group the array, solution of combinatory equations, vectors and vector spaces are included.

description.zh: 介紹 C++ 語言基本資料處理的概念， 包含基本輸入與輸出、程式的流程控制、函數的應用等指令之撰寫、程式之編輯、編譯、聯絡與程式之執行，並發展一套應用程式。
description.en: This course introduces the basic data processes of C++ language.  They include input/output, program process control, application of functions, program editing and execution, and so on.

description.zh: 本課程在於使同學瞭解管理思想的演進，與管理有關之重要理論，以及未來管理之發展趨勢。課程主要內容包括：組織與管理、管理哲學、管理思想的演進、管理功能（規畫、領導、組織、控制、評估）、溝通、組織成長與改變、未來之管理、個案研討。
description.en: This course will cover the progress of management, the theories of management and the future of management. It consists of 1. Organization and management. 2. Philosophies of management. 3. The function of management. 4. Communication. 5. The future of management. 6. Case studies.

description.zh: 零售業包含百貨業、連鎖店、超市、超商等，與人們的關係極切‧本課程主在探討如何經由零賣出使顧客滿意的商品‧內容：零售業概論、配銷通路、行銷研究、產品管理策略、定價策略、促銷策略、賣場規劃、零售業經營策略、顧客滿意
description.en: Retail management is mainly to discuss to sell goods through channels and satisfy them. The content of the course: Retail concept, physical distribution, market research, product management strategy, pricing strategy, promotion strategy, retail strategy and customer satisfaction.

description.zh: 本校之普通物理課程專為工程科系背景之同學設計，主要的目的是鼓勵同學參與大自然運行奧秘、法則之探索，並供給爾後修習專業課程之堅實基礎。本課程之內容包含力學、熱力學、聲學、電磁學、光學及近代物理。教授者可按每週三小時、二個學期的時間設計、再參酌各系不同之需求、加強或節略某些章節。
description.en: The course is designed for the students with engineering background. The theme of this course is to encourage students to participate in the discovery of laws and wonder of nature, and to solidate the foundation for the particular courses of study for different departments. The contents of this course include mechanics, dynamics, thermodynamics, electromagnetics, optics, and foundation of modern physics, etc.. The lecturers will emphasize or abridge certain contents based on the individual needs of departments. For this course, there will be 3 credits for each of two semesters,  and 3 lecture hours per week.

description.zh: 先修課程:負責教授同意力系的平衡,摩擦,面積與質量慣性矩,結構分析,虛功法。
description.en: Equivalent Systems of Forces, Equilibrium, Aera and Mass, Momemts of Inertia, Analysis of Structures of Virtual Work.

The theme of this course is to encourage students to participate in the discovery of laws and wonder of nature, and to solidate the foundation for the particular courses of study for different departments. The contents of this course include mechanics, dynamics, thermodynamics, electromagnetics, optics, and foundation of modern physics, etc.. The lecturers will emphasize or abridge certain contents based on the individual needs of departments. For this course, there will be 3 credits for each of two semesters,  and 3 lecture hours per week.

description.zh: 本課程將邀請產、官、學界知名人士，以演講或座談的方式，與EMBA學生交流溝通及討論。利用這些知名人士的實務經驗與學養，來啟發EMBA學生的創意與想法。
description.en: This course will invite the renowned individuals in business, government, and universities to exchange the ideas and opinions with the EMBA students through invited speech or seminar. The idea is to utilize the practical experience and knowledge possessed by these individuals to inspire the innovation and thinking of EMBA students.

description.zh: 本課程旨在以實務產業個案做探討。教學方式採哈佛大學個案教學方式進行。藉由分析研讀個案的學習機會，以激發出更豐富的管理創意，經由學習者的熱情投入和教師們的互動，使EMBA 學程的參與者將逐漸培養出分析和解決複雜問題的能力。除外，透過個案討論過程，使學生能於個案情境中學習相關產業及管理知識。
description.en: This course aims to explore the practical industrial cases do. Case teaching will follow Harvard University teaching manner. By analyzing the case study learning opportunities, the students will be stimulated in order to learn a more extensive management ideas. Through the enthusiasm of learners’ put in and the interaction with teacher, so that the participants EMBA learning process will gradually develop the capability to analyze and solve complex problems. Except through case discussions, so that students can learn in the context of cases related industries and management expertise.

description.zh: 本課程透過課堂演講，以講授最新管理知識或各產業之最新熱門管理議題，並透過學生分組研討使學生進一步瞭解經營管理的最新發展與趨勢。
description.en: This course focuses on lecturing, seminar, group study, and training of students' broad vision about the newly development and future trend of business management.

description.zh: 本課程介紹管理者或一般大眾在作決策時，會產生的心理偏誤。另外，本課程也提供管理者或一般大眾如何避孼心理偏誤，並改善其決策程序。本課程以心理學的角度來探討。
description.en: This course introduces how psychological biases affect individuals’ decision making processes. The psychological biases include excessive optimism, overconfidence, confirmation bias, illusion of control, representativeness, availability bias, anchoring, framing, loss aversion…etc. In addition, this course is also to discuss the related financial literature and apply the psychological theory of individual behaviour to the financial markets.

description.zh: 本課程設計為讓初學者了解並能分析在現今市場環境下，企業所面臨的財務問題。課程涵蓋企業資本評價的基本模型，包含企業金融資產的定價模式、實體資產評價與投資專案分析、資本結構分析，以及其他企業在資金管理與財務規劃預測的相關議題。目的在讓參與者對『財務決策對公司表現和價值的影響』有更深刻的認識。
description.en: The course develops theoretical framework for understanding and analyzing major financial problems of modern company in market environment. The course covers basic models of valuation of corporate capital, including pricing models for primary financial assets, real assets valuation and investment projects analysis, capital structure and various types of corporate capital employed, derivative assets and contingent claims on assets. It provides necessary knowledge in evaluating different management decisions and its influence on corporate performance and value.

description.zh: 本課程主要在介紹領導的藝術，以使學員瞭解中華傳統文化的觀點如何能增進組織治理的領導績效。課程主要涵蓋的內容包括：(1)領導的基本概念；(2)中華傳統文化的領導法則；(3)領導的案例研究；(4)領導的實踐。
description.en: This course introduces the art of leadership to the students helping them to understand how the concept of Chinese traditional culture can enhance the performance of leadership in organizational governance. Four major topics will be covered: (1) The basic concept of leadership; (2) the leadership principles of Chinese traditional culture; (3) case analysis of leadership; (4) leadership practices.

description.zh: 創新管理課程主要對象為有興趣從事企業創新發明機會或技能的學生們。此課程不僅介紹基礎發明工具而且提供課程上實際演練。主要內容包含如何辨識企業創新機會與問題；發現新點子；發展最適解答；展示創新成果與萃思方法介紹。課程上也會提出許多相關企業的應用實例討論。其目的在於幫助學生們學習了解創新工具與系統創新方法在創新管理的專業領域及利用課程上的創新工具或取更好的工作機會。
description.en: Innovation Management course focuses on the particular interest to those students who are considering development of an innovative business opportunity or innovation management skills. This course not only discusses the basics toolkits for every innovator needs, but also provides the practice workshop of systematic innovation. Major topics include how to identifying the opportunity and problem; discover the new ideas; develop the solution; demonstrate the innovation; and the TRIZ works. Many of the examples will also be discussed in their entrepreneurial approaches to innovation.Objective: To develop an understanding of innovation toolkits and systematic innovation approach to help students making better understanding in innovation management and equipping with the innovation skills needed to pursue a viable career option.

name.zh: 企業資源規劃與財金資訊系統
name.en: Enterprise Resource Planning and Financial Information System

description.zh: 本課程探討企業資源規劃系統與財金資訊系統，其中包含企業資源規劃系統(ERP)中之配銷、生產製造與財務模組與企業供應鏈管理模組。本課程包含SAP ERP的實機操做、系統導入規劃程序、專案管理技術與ERP個案導入案例分享。本課程也探討各種不同型態的財金資訊系統，並介紹程式交易、演算法交易與高頻交易的主題與應用。
description.en: This course considers the enterprise resource planning (ERP) system and the financial information system. This course covers the three modules of ERP system, including the modules of sale and distribution, production and manufacture and finance. The course also contains the operation instructions for SAP ERP system, the process planning of ERP system implementation, the skills of project management and the case studies of ERP implementation. This course also covers the discussion of different types of financial information system and introduces concepts of program trading, algorithmic trading and high frequency trading.

description.zh: 本課程主要以近年國內外金融相關議題為主體，透過較嚴謹的研究方法，深入淺出地討論風險與報酬、金融危機與蔓延效應、效率市場、投資人的投資行為、行為財務、房價泡沫、金融機構的利潤與風險、券商利益衝突、政治與金融的關係等議題，並特別探討企業購併個案研究的主題。
description.en: This course aims at introducing financial issues including risk and return, financial crisis and contagion effect, efficient market, investor behavior, behavioral finance, housing bubble, profits and risk in financial institutions, conflict of interests of securities companies, and the relationship between politics and finance. Special focus on case studies of mergers and acquisitions will be provided.

description.zh: 研究期刊內容，針對學生之學習，提出研究心得閱讀報告，集體討論，以訓練學生研究之能力。
description.en: Group Discussion. Literature Study, Seminar, Group meeting.

description.zh: 本課程在討論金屬性質與應用在整形外科和牙醫界。課程內容包括生醫材料之發展,牙醫材料之應用,複合材料在生醫工程之應用,生醫陶瓷,生醫材料之腐蝕機制以及生醫材料之工程問題。
description.en: The topics of this course include the properties of metals and polymeric materials, and their applications in the orthopedic and dental fields. The course contains the development of biomaterials, the application of materialsfor dentistry and dental surgery, composite materials in biomedical engineering, bioceramics, corrosion mechanisms of metallic biomaterials and engineering problems associated with materials.

notes: 日間部與進修部在職專班合開

description.zh: 1.電子光學簡介 2.穿透式電子顯微鏡之結構與成像原理 3.電子繞射理論 4.電子繞射圖型及缺陷分析方法 5.掃瞄式電子顯微鏡之結構與成像原理6. EDS及WDS之X光光譜分析
description.en: 1.Introduction to electron optics2. Electron Beam and Their Interaction with Specimen3. Electron Diffraction4. The Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM)5. The Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) 6. Chemical Analysis in the Electron Microscope

description.zh: 本課程主要是開設給已經修過"粉末冶金學"的學生，對粉末冶金製程與粉末冶金技術的應用有更進一步的認識。課程的安排在製程方面，強調粉末特性對粉末冶金製程的影響，成形模具的設計，燒結理論與現象，燒結体的後處理等。應用方面以本國現有的粉末冶金工廠與其製品為主，例如：機械零件、超硬工具材料、磁性材料、電接點材料、摩擦材料等製程的講述。
description.en: This course is a special topics of  Topic of powder metallurgy.

name.en: Special Topics of Materials Science and Engineering

description.zh: 本課程主要針對非材料系背景之研究生開設， 對各種材料（金屬、陶瓷、高分子、複合材料）之基本原理，性質及應用，做概要性的介紹。內容包括材料之晶體結構與晶體缺陷，固體材料之原子擴散，相圖與相變化，材料製程及應用，材料之物理性質（光性質、電性質、磁性質及熱性質）.
description.en: Special topics in 1.The structure of crystalline solids. 2.Imperfections in solids. 3.Phase transformation and phase equilibrium. 4.Strengthening mechanism of materials. 5.Metal alloys 6.Ceramics 7.Polymers

description.zh: 加強學生之學習研究心得報告，集體討論，以訓練學生研究之能力。
description.en: Group Discussion. Literature Study, Seminar, Group meeting.

description.zh: 提供本校四技學生在本行以外，對其他領域的認識，以彌補其只鑽研專業課程的偏頗，訓練學生整合知識，使不致在知識爆炸的時代中迷失，促進各種專材的溝通，培養共識；培育人文素養，啟發人文關懷，使具有完整的人生觀。
description.en: This course offers a good opportunity for four-year college students in this university to have an easier access to a completely different field of knowledge, in the hope that  students can add their individual professional knowledge and broaden their minds. The students will be furnished with integrated knowledge, discovering a better way towards professional communication, developing more common sense and never losing themselves in this information-explosive age. With a solid basis on humanity and liberal ideology, they are sure to find a more complete picture of human life.

name.en: Legal Affairs and Dispute resolution in Construction

description.zh: 本課程主要教授與土木有關之法規，諸如建築法、建築技術規則、都市計劃法、採購法、環保法規、水利法等，併借相關案例之分析研究，訓練學生土木法規之知識與能力。
description.en: The course is dive lessons on code of building , rule of construction technology ,stock up code ,code of environmental protection etc.

description.zh: 知識管理是二十一世紀知識與學習型企業發展知識經濟最主要的技能，而營建與土木工程是一個需要專業知識的技術型產業，故亦應融入知識管理之理念。本課程基於上述理念，分別介紹營建興土木工程之相關專業技能，知識管理與企業e化發展技術，進而探討營建導入知識管理之技巧與方法。
description.en: Knowledge Management(KM) is the most important technique of learning type business for developing knowledge economy in the 21st century.Construction and civil engineering need to conduct knowledge management due to they are complex and full with professional techniques.This course will introduce related professional techniques of construction and civil engineering,the development technology of knowledge management and a e business,also will illustrate the conducting methods of construction knowledge management.

description.zh: 山坡地開發、規劃與施工，高樑建築基礎施工與監測，水庫工程之調查與規劃，捷運系統規劃、調查與施工。
description.en: 英課名：The geography engineering case analyze        To open up and develop mountain slope, plan and         construction.        Base construction and to monitor of high beam         building.        Investigate and plan of reservoir engineering.        A rapid transit system plan, investigate and         construction.

description.zh: 本課程主要係研討調查方法、穩定分析、坡地災害成因、坡地監測、防災及管理配套措施、以使同學了解山坡地工程於規劃設計及施工等階段，應如何進行減少災害和實行適當管理。
description.en: This course will focus on the site investigation ,stability analysis ,failure analysis ,in-situ monitoring ,disaster prevention  ,and risk management of natural slopes. It is designed to give students a better understanding of slope protection and slope management during various stages（such as planning，design and construction）of the slope development.

notes: 3/3~4/14週二上課；4/21之後改為週五上課

description.zh: 1.橋樑結構分析2.RC橋設計3.規範闡釋
description.en: Advanced Bridge Engineering 1.Analysis of Structures of Bridge2.Design of RC-Bridges3.Explanation of Specifications

description.zh: 本課程主要探討物業管理理論以及實際的操作手法。並結合現有的物業管理案例說明其實例運作方式在台灣的課題與機會。
description.en: The scope of this curriculum encompasses the theories of the propertymanagement, including:1. Introduction(The definition of Reuse, Reduce and  Recycle).2. Main methodologies and evaluating tools of building-reuse.3. Case study: Mass housing renewal in European countries & Japan.4.Renewal operation of infill-based building components: Case study on Partitions, kitchens& Sanitary spaces.5. Relation between Building renewal and urban tissue.

description.zh: 說明古蹟及歷史建築之研究價值，研究對象，探討由古蹟建築之時代、地理位置、社會文化環境內容、人為環境內容、組織建築空間與構築建築實體，及其影響因素等各層面來進行研究之過程與方法。透過國內外相關理論與實物的個案分析，現場觀摩與實習，研討台灣古蹟保存與再利用的理論，法源與技術。
description.en: This course will systematically discuss various themes of historical building, including the building's architectural characters and the influent sectors of that social cultural circumstance (ex. historic period, site, or person…) . By way of the reading and discussing about the relative theory and works, that student can understand the though and technique of the architectural preservation and reuse.

notes: 建都所與在職專班合開

name.en: Special Topic of integration and application of Building Information Modeling (BIM)

description.zh: 建築資訊模型(Building Information Modeling)結合了建築設計、施工規劃、機電整合、生態節能以及美學等應用，是未來建築產業趨勢。本課程以BIM平台架構為中心，講述台灣建築產業面臨建築設計、施工、機電等多面向的整合。內容包括概念設計、建築設計、文件紀錄與施工規劃、建築與環境耗能分析以及環境控制等應用整合。藉由探討BIM的內涵、策略與技術，了解BIM在建築設計上的實際應用。並介紹演練REVIT 及ECOTECT兩種BIM軟體。
description.en: Building Information Modeling (BIM) is an intelligent model-based process that provides insight for creating and managing building and infrastructure projects faster, more economically, and with less environmental impact. This course focus on introducing BIM system which includes a comprehensive portfolio of solutions for design, visualization, simulation, and collaboration that uses the rich information in the intelligent model to inform better decision-making and break down the barriers to better business.

notes: 建都所與在職專班合開

description.zh: 為追求「永續發展與人本健康」之目的，使既有與新建的居住環境，配合我國「室內空氣品質管理法」規範下運作，提昇民眾居住環境健康品質效益，針對病態建築之環境問題，其涵蓋醫療、法律、建築、化學、生物等領域，綜合診斷以進行改善。本課程為第二階段之系列課程，其內容包括：一.孼疫學：探討關於病態建築症候群的因素與特定外來的致病物質與孼疫之關聯。二.家政事務：探討生活習慣、飲食生活的變化對環境、人體健康之影響。三.醫療領域：探討病態建築症候群與化學物質過敏症的差異與因應對策。四.日常領域：探討日常生活用品、居住行為對環境、人體健康之影響。
description.en: The main goal of this class is to pursue sustainable development and human health. In order to enhance the quality of residential and living environment in both existing and new-build dwellings, the course will cover important principles and topics in sick building environment, including medical, regulation, and architecture, chemical and biological. Specific contents include:(1)Immunology: to introduce the interactions between the immune system and the factors of sick building syndrome (SBS) and some specific pathogens.(2)Behavioral science: to investigate the influence of dietary and habit changes on environmental and human health.(3)Medical care: to introduce the difference and the response strategies between sick building syndrome (SBS) and Multiple Chemical Sensitivity (MCS)(4)Daily life: to investigate the influence of daily articles and resident behavior on environmental and human health.

notes: 建都所與建都所與在職專班合開、設計博班合開

description.zh: 1.建築管理行政體系及法源介紹。2.建築管理之對象人、事、物介紹。3.建築許可之申請、審核、核發、列管及追蹤作業。4.建築物之施工管理及工程糾紛處理。5.建築物使用與變更使用之管理。6.建築物昇降設備管理制度介紹。7.建築物違章之查報與拆除。8.建築物公共安全檢查法律依據及作業程序。9.建築管理的發展方向。10.建築師及營造業管理之基本概念及未來之工作方向。
description.en: 1.	Introducing the hierarchical of building department and government administration rules of the building.2.	Introducing administrative terms of building with owner, designer or supervisor of building, construction work, building site, and building itself.3.	Application procedure for a building permit, include application, judgement, approbation, management and audit.4.	Administration for Building construction and construction dispute intermediation.5.	Administration for building occupancy and alterations.6.	Introducing administration of building elevator facilities.7.	Illegal building administration and dismantling.8.	Inspection procedure for building safety and procedure rules.9.	The development direction of building administration.10.	The basic concept and executive direction in the future for administration of Architect and construction.

description.zh: 本課程首先介紹社區的階層意義及規劃程序及方法，其次舊社區規劃的主要內涵包括土地使用規劃、運輸規劃、公共設施規劃各以理論發展及案例操作說明，尤其是土地使用與運輸規劃之整合及鄰避性公共設施規劃案例之舉證。在就社區規劃後之整體開發方式說明，如何由二度的平面規劃成為三度空間的開發。期中考後將針對更前瞻性及更細緻的規劃技巧作為授課的內容，包括生態社區規劃的方法、災害及防災規劃，並舉科技的發展包括網際網路及捷運之發達對社區規劃的衝擊及因應。最後舉全球化及競爭力對社區發展的影響。另外以本人服務於實務界多年，得由同學指定欲瞭解或探討的課題由教師準備講授，以增加共同討論的意願，冀讓同學能對生活的空間有個全貌的初識。二個學分的課程僅能讓同學對環境有所管窺，希望加上其他的課程，讓同學進而因之他、關懷他、愛他而願意以專業與他結緣終生，那怕我們沒有好的居住環境！
description.en: This course is an introduction on the meaning of community hierarchy, the procedure and methodology of planning, as well as theoretical developments and case studies regarding major planning issues such as land use, transportation, and case studies on NIMBY facilities.Furthermore, I will also demonstrate planned unit developments and how to transform a two-dimensional planning into a three-dimensional development.After the midterm, I'll focus on more foresighted and deliberate planning techniques, including ecological community planning methods, disaster-preventive, planning, and the possible coping measures with respect to the impacts resulting from technological advances such as the internet and the mass transit systems. description.en: This course offers a good opportunity for four-year college students in this university to have an easier access to a completely different field of knowledge, in the hope that  students can add their individual professional knowledge and broaden their minds. The students will be furnished with integrated knowledge, discovering a better way towards professional communication, developing more common sense and never losing themselves in this information-explosive age. With a solid basis on humanity and liberal ideology, they are sure to find a more complete picture of human life.

description.zh: 人際關係是探討對自我的了解及對人的認知，包括性格、態度、魅力、溝通、壓力、挫折和情緒等重要課題的處理；幫助同學學習與各種不同品味、信念、立場與生活方式的人作有效率的溝通，開放的表達出自己的感覺與想法，以建立良好的合作關係，從而開發潛能、爭取更好的發展機會。溝通是人際關係中重要的手段，本課程提供學生對溝通知識的了解，並熟悉溝通的實務運用。課程重心涵蓋溝通的本質與觀念性架構，溝通的理論與模型，溝通的規劃、執行與控制，溝通的策略與技能。
description.en: Interpersonal Relationship is to discuss about self-understanding and perception of other people, including how to handle key issues related to character, attitude, attractiveness, communication, pressure, frustration and emotion. It helps students to learn effective communication, open their minds to express personal feeling and thought, and try to communicate with other people having different tastes, convictions, standpoints and ways of living so as to establish a harmonic and cooperative relationship and develop personal potential and strive for better opportunity of development. The course discuss about the communication issue from business manager. It introduces the concepts of communication and the practice about communication. The core of the course include the knowledge of communication and structure、theory and models.

description.zh: 本課程旨在針對流通業中各項經營管理項目作探討，其中包含設施位置選定，人力資源，流通規劃，及銷售促進等。此外，商用地理資訊系統之應用及個案研討亦包含在此課程中。
description.en: The purpose of this course is to study the required management issues of retail business，such as location selection，human resource ，retail planning ，and marketing etc。Besides，at also includes business GIS and case study.

name.zh: 國際金融市場與經濟情勢分析
name.en: The Outlook and Analysis of Global Economy and Financial Markets

description.zh: 即時掌握國際金融市場與經濟情勢的變化是企業經營管理中不可或缺的一環。2008年美國次級房貸危機引發全球金融海嘯，以歐美為首的成熟經濟體陷入嚴重衰退，在各國財政與貨幣利多措施紛紛出檯之際，全球經濟似有好轉跡象，然全球金融市場多年來處於極度寬鬆的利率環境，是否也正將經濟推向另一個潛在的失衡點中，值得探究。本課程將以時事分析的方式，引導同學對於重要國際經濟及金融市場做進一步的了解，同時分析相關經濟情勢對金融市場之影響、全球經濟的蝴蝶效應，以及潛藏之系統性風險與所可能衍生之金融危機，冀幫助學生提早掌握全球經濟與金融變化徵兆，並做好預應策略。
description.en: The main objective is to enable students to work effectively in the context of international financial and economic uncertainty. International financial events are both pervasive and important and it is important for managers to understand the Outlook and Analysis of Global Economy and Financial Markets.Economic activity in several major middle-income economies are weak. Global financial markets also suffered from a bout of turbulence. Recently Global financial conditions have turned supportive. Stable or declining commodity prices have been a positive for commodity importers but a negative for exporters.In this course, we explore the conditions of financial markets (such as those for bonds, stocks, and foreign exchange). Financial markets and institutions not only affect our everyday life but also involve huge flows of funds throughout our economy, which in turn affect business profits, and even the economic prospects of the world. name.en: Industry Strategic Planning and Technology Road-Mapping

description.zh: 產業策略規劃與技術布局課程旨在教育學生對高科技、傳統與服務產業之屬性深入了解與培養策略規劃之核心能力，並且藉由跨領域實作課程中，學習技術布局流程，以培養科技大學學生進入職場之策略規劃與技術布局能力。課程包含六大新興、四大智慧、十大服務產業之策略規劃學理內涵、流程、技術研析與布局，並由案例說明導引分組討論與發表。
description.en: The purpose of the "Industry Strategic Planning and Technology Road-Mapping" class is to educate students to have the more insight capability on the Hi-Tech, Conventional, and Service Industries and to learn the processes of the strategic planning and technology road-mapping. This is also intent to assist the Technology University students to shorten their industry learning curve once they are hired. The class will introduce the Taiwan six emerging industries, four intelligent industries, and ten service industries including the background, justifications, process, and technology roadmap. Also, it will have the several case-studies to lead the student to do the exercise through the group discussion and present their findings and results.

description.en: The teaching goal is to establishing students have a Health life、Sportsmanship、Team work and Life time exercise habit.  All Freshman students are required to attend two hours per week of Physical Education class.  For Freshman level, Classes focus on basic physical strength training.

description.zh: 本校體育課程目標為鍛鍊健全身心、促進身心健全發展、培養運動道德、發揚團隊精神及養成終身運動習慣。二技三年級實施普通班體育正課教學。
description.en: The teaching goal is to establishing students have a Health life、Sportsmanship、Team work and Life time exercise habit.  All Freshman students are required to attend two hours per week of Physical Education class.  For Freshman level, Classes focus on basic physical strength training.

description.zh: 選修介紹材料通性、分類與應用，並深入高分子生成之聚合反應、反應機構、反應動力學、熱力學、聚合物之材料構造、聚合方法、分子量之測定、分子量分佈以及一般檢測高分子特性之技術。
description.en: This course is concerned primarily with the synthesis, properties, and technology of synthetic polymers. Topics include polymerization, structure and properties, characterization , and properties of commercial polymers

notes: 待聘-李文亞,合進二化四

description.zh: 本課程在闡述化學工業中以環保出發的催化劑之原理與應用。內容包括催化劑之化學結構、反應性、製備、物性鑑定、反應動力學分析。由催化循環、反應機制、催化劑結構、動力學來說明催化反應之原理。除此，並著重於介紹各催化反應應用類型：催化反應在溶液中、酵素、沸石孔洞及重要之工業固相觸媒。
description.en: This course explores the principles and applications of catalysts for the environmentally benign chemical processes. Topics include the concepts in chemical structure and reactivity of catalyst, catalyst preparation, catalyst characterization, and micro kinetic analysis of catalytic processes. The principles are illustrated with catalytic cycles, reaction mechanisms, catalyst structures, and kinetics. Additionally, we emphasis on applications of catalysis in solution, enzymes, solid and surfaces, within the molecular-scale cages of zeolites and sieves, the most important industrial catalysts.

description.zh: 利用基因工程，生物化學、微生物學之原理，培養變種之微生物（或改良過的微生物），動、植物細胞，以製造生物活性物質（如抗生素、免疫體、酵素、毒素、激素、特殊結構之蛋白、脂肪、醣類、脂肪酸、氨基酸、生長因子、藥理活性成份、抗體等等）
description.en: By the application of genetic engineering, biochemistry and microorganisms or animal or plant cells and how to produce living organisms.

description.zh: 本課程是針對近代生物學感興趣的學生所設計，內容涵蓋生命與能量、細胞與分子生物學、生物多樣性、動植物的結構與功能、遺傳訊息的傳遞、生命的演化與生態。讓學生瞭解生命體系的輪廓，為生物科技的基礎課程。
description.en: A one-term introductory course intended for students interesting in modern life science. This course will cover topics in energy and life, cellular and molecular biology, biological diversity, structure and function of plant and animal, and transmission genetics. Principles of evolution and ecology will also be covered.

description.zh: 本課程之重點在於將熱力學機基本定律,應用於較為實際的化工問題上.主要內容包括:熱力學及輸送現象性質之估算方法,氣液相平衡及液液相平衡在分離製程的應用等.
description.en: The objectives of this course are to apply principles of thermodynamics in practical chemical processes. The contents of the curricula are 1) estimation of the thermodynamic and transport properties of fluids and solids, 2) vapor-liquid equilibrium as well as liquid-liquid equilibrium for separation processes application.

description.zh: 本課程的目標在使學生了解工業安全衛生的重要,熟悉有關知識及緊急措施,從而增加處變之因應能力.內容包括工業安全衛生組織,事故調查分析,工廠設備安全要領,工業衛生和衛生設備.
description.en: TThis course is design to introduce the student to concept of the importance of industrial safety and health with emphasis on the ability of dealing with accidents. Topics covered are organization of industrial safety , analysis of Accident ,industrial health and facilities.

notes: 待聘-崔宏瑋,合進二化三

name.zh: 高分子材料與複合材料

description.zh: 授課內容包括高分子及複合材料的製程、結構及性質等綜合知識，首先介紹機械混練與接枝共聚合等基本製程方法，並探討交穿網狀高分子合膠材料，以及含浸顆粒狀、纖維狀、板狀等強化高分子複合材料的結構形態與工程性質之相關原理。
description.en: Synthesis, morphology and engineering behavior of polymer and composite materials. Mechanical blend alloys, block and graft copolymers, interpenetrating polymer networks, polymer impregnated particulate, fiber and sheet-reinforce polymeric composites are emphasized.

description.zh: 邀請校內外學者專家至校針對某一專長領域進行專題演講，讓學生藉由聽講及心得報告之寫作，開展視野，並與時代之脈動相契合。(在職專班)
description.en: Invited speakers from different disciplines give speech in their specialized area. Thus students can broaden their eyesight and also keep updating the technology and its applications of the generation.

name.en: Regional Methodology on Landscape and Architecture

description.zh: 本課程以地域論述為中心講述有關知識體系的基礎和架構。第一部份涵蓋人文主義地理學、文化地景、以及存在主義及其支系的現象學等基礎；第二部份講授以上述知識論為主的地景和建築詮釋與實踐，包括城市規劃、建築和地景建築理論等範疇的相應，介紹地域論者如Lewis Mumford, Liane Lefaivre, Alexander Tzonis, Kenneth Frampton等人的觀點。第三部分為以台灣地區地域地景與建築思維的議題導向，進一步充實地域文化的空間-形式的智性思維。
description.en: This course is underpinned upon the epistemology of Regionalism that consisted of three parts. The first part traces back to Humanistic Geography, Cultural Landscape, Existentialism and its philosophical branch line-phenomenology, which are sources of the Regionalism. The second part is centered on interpretation and implementation in either landscape or architecture disciplines, in relation to the perspectives of city planning, architecture, and landscape architecture. And Regionalist advocates like Lewis Mumford, Liane Lefaivre, Alexander Tzonis, Kenneth Frampton and so on are included. The third part involves the regional issues by local-oriented issues of Taiwan. A few of cultural Space-From topics are introduced to substantiate intellectual understandings.

notes: 建都所與在職專班合開

name.en: Theory and Practice of Landscape Ecological Design

description.zh: 景觀生態學是以生態學理論來理解並建立一套可以認知景觀與其中的生物﹑非生物環境關係的學科。有關景觀的生態設計理論基本上是將這一系列景觀生態學模型或原理作為設計指標而形成的一套設計操作理論。景觀生態原理在景觀學科中具有極其根本的角色，不僅在景觀資源保育與管理上提供極具價值的參考；對於景觀規畫與設計實務者更提供了在不同尺度範疇狀況下三向度空間設計的形態準則。因此，課程涵蓋了從區域、基地和細部設計三種尺度的設計內涵，講述及操作在基於不同目的的需求時，人為景觀如何介入自然環境，以及導入的人為景觀的設計準則。1. 景觀生態與形態理論2. 景觀生態設計理論3. 景觀生態設計理論的應用    a. 都市地區和鄉村地區        b. 區域、基地和細部設計尺度
description.en: Landscape ecology seeks for principles and models that contribute to dealing with conservation, management, and design in landscape practice. The course "Landscape Theory and Practice of Ecological Design" refers to those principles and models established in landscape ecology and then applies to landscape planning and design. Issues relates to this courses are listed as follows;1. Landscape Ecology and landscape morphology2.  Ecological design theory3.  The application of ecological theory in landscape         practice     a. Urban region and countryside         b. Macro-sale, meso-sale, and micro-scale

description.zh: 加強學生之學習研究心得報告，集體討論，以訓練學生研究之能力。
description.en: Group Discussion. Literature Study, Seminar, Group meeting.

description.zh: 因是在大專教藝術欣賞的課程，我在設計課程上，即考慮雖同學們不是藝術本科學生，但秉持"雖創作，但會欣賞的原則"，我的課程安排將從上古時代人類的美術創作活動進而引導解釋什麼是人類的美感經驗。讓他們明瞭東方藝術之同與不同，再介紹東西方的繪畫潮流，如西方：從文藝復興至寫實主義，印象主義，至超印象主義，東方：從漢的畫象磚開始至中國畫，書法之演進，中西繪畫之比較，內容是繁而多的。但我將用簡潔扼要的"重點教學法",寓教於樂的方式，讓同學不再懼怕"Art'，甚至可以簡單的分辨出藝術品的年代，作者，及欣賞藝術作品的要領，這是我給此門課所訂的目標。另一個教學重點是："理論和實際併重"。在每一單元中，我將設計一項簡的[自己動手做]大概祇花 20-30 分鐘讓學生體會和真正看見，明白，藝術家製造藝術品的過程。很希望能帶學生至博物院或美術館一趟，或至鶯砍參觀陶工廠。總之，一切課程計劃，乃配合學生之程度與興趣。
description.en: Because most students taking this course are not art major; therefore, I adhere to the principle of "Although not creation, appreciation will be instructed."  On course design, my class starts from the artistic creation of human beings in prehistoric time and further introduces the experience of beauty sensed by man and understand the similiar and difference of eastern and western art.  Moreover, I will introduce the fashion of priniting of eastern and western culture.  For example, the western culture: from the Renaissance to realism, impressionism and super impressionism.  Western culture: from a portrait stone of Han Dynasty to Chinese painting, the develpment of calligraphy and comparison of Chinese and western paintings. The teaching content is complicated, but I will simply it and highlight teaching way to let my students enjoy it.

description.zh: 新經濟與舊經濟的分野不是在有『e』還是沒有『e』，而是在有『i』還是沒有『i』，而『i』就是『Innovation，創新』。二十一世紀的『腦力經濟』最重要的戲規則就是『智慧財產權』，同時也是WTO會員國必須遵守的重要規範之一。課程內容主要包括三個最基本的智慧財產權課題：專利權，商標權，以及著作權；而為配合本校學生學科背景，本課程將較著重於『專利』方面的實務知識，並且講授『如何激發創意，以培養學生日後能好好應用『智慧財產權』的保護。
description.en: The difference between New-economy and Old-economy is not caused by having "e" or not having "e", but caused by owining "i" or not owning "i". where "I" means "Innovation:.  Intellectual Property is not only the most importance business rule of the :Brain economy era:, but also one of the most important agreements among WTO members.  This course includes the basic three subjects of Intellectual Property:Patent, Trademark, and Copyright.  In order to accommodate the learning background for most of NTUT students, the contents of this course will focus more on the practical practice of the Patennt.  In addition, it also includes the subject of "how to activate your creativeness:so as to make students can use what they learn, "Intellectual Property:, to protect their intellectual work.

description.zh: 西藥及中草藥是中華民族的傳統藥，也是中國藥學寶庫的重組成成分，中草藥包括中藥、草藥（即民間藥）以及少數民族地區使用的民族藥，在中國，使用中草藥防病治病已有數千年之歷史，寶鑑證明，中草藥療效確切，副作用較合成中藥少，力來深受群眾喜愛。當前，人類健康需要傳統醫藥之觀點正為越來越多之國家和人民接受，開發傳統要已成為當今藥物發展的潮流。同時，近年來科學研究成果表明，從中草藥發展出療效好，毒性低的新藥是一條成功的捷徑。因此，學習中草藥之人員日漸增加。本課程共分：西藥概論、中草藥概論、內科中草藥、兒科中草藥、男科中草藥、婦科中草藥、美容養生中草藥等。
description.en: The Drugs on Life is a two credit hours course and design especially for technology students. This curriculum emphasizes on the clinical applications and action mechanisms of various western and Chinese drugs. The curriculum trends will start from more details and bring a completely concepts. The subjects include neuropharmacology, autacoids, cardiovascular drugs, analgesics, anaethesia and drugs actiong on the central nervous system, chemotherapy of microbial disease and neoplastic disease, hormones and hormone antagonists, drugs acting on the blood and some Chinese drugs.

description.zh: 本課程以培養學生尊重與欣賞不同族群、不同時空、不同價值觀所產生的音樂而設。藉由對音樂元素、本質的認知及介紹，欣賞各時期作曲家之代表作品，培養西方音樂的基本常識，建立音樂欣賞的專業態度。教學目標：1.提高學生音樂欣賞的素養，充實其音樂生活的內涵，2.激發學生對音樂的興趣，培育愛樂人口，增進社會祥和的原動力，3.介紹古今中外音樂名家名作，啟發學生對音樂創作的認知與敬重，4.建立學生對古典音樂、民族音樂、應用音樂及通俗音樂等不同類型音樂的正確認知與包容力，培養世界性的音樂觀。授課內容：1.概論, 2.歌樂, 3.器樂, 4.儀式音樂, 5.舞蹈音樂, 6.戲劇音樂。
description.en: This course aims to cultivate students' ability to appreciate music of different ethnic groups, different time and place, different value systems. Through the introduction of basic music elements as well as the appreciation of the masterpieces of various composers, it is hoped that students will build up basic music knowledge about music and enhance professional music appreciation potentiality in music. The goals include: 1. Elevating students' capability in music appreciation 2. Inspiring students' interest in music with a view to improving our society into a harmonious world. 3. Introducing domestic and international famous composers' pieces 4. Touring of various forms of music: classical, ethnic, applied and popular music. Contents of this course include: 1.Introduction 2. Vocal music 3. Instrumental music 4. Ritual music 5. Dance music 6. Theatre music

description.zh: 這e世紀時代的資訊交流是一個廣泛、多樣化與複雜的；究竟人們如何透過溝通表達意識與行為，卻變成非常重要。有效的溝通程度常視為學習溝通的指標，須視事實、竟見、感覺、嗜好和經驗進行徹底地交融與分享的結果。因此，本課程重視現代社會學習「溝通管理」的二項關鍵技術包括：有效溝通結合自我學習技巧和方法：商業知識與科技結合促成人的系統互動能力，配合多媒體傳輸工具完成學習個人與團體溝通效益。課程涵概主題:1.溝通管理定義與本質元素。2.溝通管理內涵分析。3.學習個人溝通能力。4.學習溝通程序。5.e化自我學習技巧、方法與表達能力。6.學習全球化溝通科技工具。7.團隊溝通的策略與協同戰術。8.塑造整體溝通文化。
description.en: The information exchange is wide, variety, and complicated in the e-era; how do people express their consciousness and behavior turn to become very important. Effective communication degrees usually are seen as the index of learning communication. It depends on thoroughly melting and sharing with fact, opinion, feeling, interesting and experience. Therefore, "Communication Management," in this course we emphasize on two key techniques of modern society learning including: effective communication with self-learning skill and method; Business knowledge and technology with interactive ability of human system. By using multimedia transmitting tools to complete self and group learning communication and get benefit.Course Subjects:1. Definition and essential element of Communication Management.2. Content analysis of Communication Management.3. Learn personal communication ability.4. Learn communication process.5. E-learning skill, method, and expression ability.6. Learn the technical tools

description.zh: 面對日益複雜的社會現象與社會組織，生活規範已由傳統的道德習俗，逐漸代之以法律倫理，生活在現代化的社會，有必要從認知法理、遵守法律，進而要求落實法治。俾政府施政依法而治，社會倫理得以重建，個人權益亦獲得確實的保障。本課程兼顧理論與實例的探討，包括法律的理念與概念、法律與社會生活各層面的關聯性、現行法體制的基本認識、法治生活的檢視與展望。
description.en: Facing increasingly complicated social phenomena and organization, norms of life are governed by laws instead of traditional moral customs. Living in modern society, it is necessary to have a better understanding of the law, so that people will abide by the law and further thoroughly implement the legal system to ensure that the government administration may be performed in accordance with the law. In this way, social ethic may be re-established and individual's benefit may be protected. The discussion in the course covers theory and examples, including the concept of the law, law and politic, law and society, law and life, etc.

description.zh: 台灣的歷史從無文字傳統的原住民起，到17世紀西班牙、荷蘭海上競逐開始，漢人隨之移墾台灣，成為這塊土地最主要的住民。本課程的內容將依時間先後，將荷蘭西班牙殖民時期、鄭氏王國、清代台灣、日治時期與國民政府時期重要歷史大事、人物等依據講義講解，內容有政治、宗教、文化、經濟、社會等各層面的重要事件、人物以及歷史發展。
description.en: The history of Taiwan originated from the aboriginal culture in which no written languages were included. In the 17th century when the Spanish and the Netherlands were competing for the maritime power, the Hans immigrated into the island and became the main resident. The course will be taught in the temporal order: colonial periods under the Spanish and the Netherlands, Zheng's Kingdom, Taiwan under the Qing Dynasty, Taiwan under the Japanese Domination and Taiwan under the Nationalist Government. All the significant events and important figures will be discussed in class--on politics, religion, culture, economy and social development.

description.zh: 本課程的設計以歷史趨勢的闡述及專題研究分析二方面同時進行。課程方面包括中、西歷史觀念的比較與中國歷代政治、經濟、社會、文化的歷史演進，藉以幫助學生認識時代之趨勢與意義。授課方式以口頭講述為主，討論及書面報告為輔，期使學生在短時間內，能對中國歷史有一簡要而清晰的了解，深化學生的歷史感。
description.en: Methodologically, the course is performed in two ways at the same time: interpretation of historical trends as well as the study and analysis of specific topics. The course will cover: comparison of historical concepts and the historical development of a long term of Chinese history in the fields of politics, economics, society and culture so that the students who take this course will sure understand better the trends and significance as the historical time spans go by. Class activities are made up of: lectures, student discussion and paper presentation. The students who take this course will have a brief but clear understanding of the Chinese history in a short time-thus embedding themselves with a deeper sense of history.

description.zh: 大眾傳播與人類社會的關係，正隨科技的進步而日益擴大它的影響力。根據學者研究發現，人類的思想、態度與價值觀念受大眾傳播的影響日漸加深，大傳媒介不但塑造人的思想，同時也影響人們的行為及價值；然而從傳播的功能言，大眾傳播同時具有正面與負面的社會功能，故大眾傳播的發展與過程，殊值重視與探討。本課程兼顧理論與實例的探討，包括傳播特性與要素、大眾傳播的能及效果、新聞守門人理論等，並以實例分析新聞的公正客觀性、新聞自由與國家安全、媒體與選舉等傳播爭議性問題。修習本課程可培養學生閱讀新聞的正確性，不玫人云亦云，受媒體報導所擺佈；同時亦可增強學生人際溝通的技巧與能力。
description.en: With the advancement of technology, mass communication is enlarging its influence in human society.  According to  researches, the thoughts, attitudes and value judgements of humans are deeply affected by mass communication.  The media not only shape persons' thoughts, but also have an impact on their behavior and values.  Since mass communication has positive and negative social functions at the same time, its development and process are therefore worthy of paying much attention and exploration to us.  This course includes the study of the theory and practice of mass communication, such as characteristics and elements functions and effects, as well as the theory of the news gatekeepers.  It also uses stories to analyze disputed issues, for example, news objectivism, freedom of the press and national security, and media and election.  Learning this course, students will be not only capable of cultivating the ability to read a news correctl

description.zh: 本課程是為非電影系的大專學生所設計的，希望在一個學期的課程中，能使學生對電影藝術有概括的了解。課程包括電影原理與形式美學、電影史、以及電影理論；以影片(某段時期的作品)與形式分析交互進行。上課方式為：講課、影片觀賞與討論，所觀賞的影片兼及經典與當代作品，例如：卓別林、希區考克、史匹柏、珍康萍等導演的作品。本課程的重點在原理的說明和理論的探討，使學生能以新的角度解讀電影，具有深度評析電影的能力。
description.en: This course is designed to give non-film major college students a comprehensive understanding of film within one semester.  The goal of the course is to provide a survey of some major topics in cinema studies which are organized into three sections: film production and techniques, history, and criticism and theory.  Course activities include lectures, film/video screenings, and discussions.  Not only classic but also contemporary works will be screened, such as the films of Charles Chaplin, Serger Eisesnsten, Alfred Hitchcock, Steven Spielberg, Jane Campion and David Cronenberg. Although the course will focus primarily on theory, discussion are welcome.

description.zh: 生態與環境保護是廿世紀的新課題，也是人類目前及未來所面臨的最大考驗。因為環境問題是超越國界的，因此環境的保護是每個人都必須瞭解的，也是每個人應盡的責任。本課程首先在了解生態環境與生活素質的關係，並了解環境污染問題的產生及其分類，再就台灣環境問題之所在分析其根源，最後了解台灣環境實施之現況後，並共同研究解決之道。
description.en: Introduction to Ecology and Environmental Protection is a brand new issue of the 20th century; also, it is the biggest challenge of all human beings and our offspring. Because environmental protection is an international issue, everyone got to realize its importance and take some action. This lesson is designed to help students understand the connection between our ecological environment and our living condition, the environmental pollution problems and their classification, the environmental problems in Taiwan, and the solution to Taiwan's environmental problems after the situation introduction.

description.zh: 本課程之目標為：充實生活技能、提升科技素養、豐富生活內涵、培養繼續進修之興趣與能力，以奠定終身學習及生涯發展之基礎。本課程之內容為：一、電腦基本概念，二、電腦功能與應用，三、資料處理，四、資訊管理，五、資訊網路，六、電腦的聲光世界，七、電腦的安全問題與防治，八、未來的資訊社會。
description.en: This course is designed to help student to learn another skill, better understand technology, enrich there live and inspire their interests for further study. The course includes: 1.basic knowledge of computer; 2.the application of computer; 3.data procession; 4.data control; 5.internet; 6.multimedia; 7.computer virus; 8. the world of information.

description.zh: 人類社會中的經濟活動愈來愈錯綜，人與人之間的經濟關係也愈來愈複雜，但無非都是為求經濟問題的解決。如何將有限的資源在諸多可行的途徑中，選擇最有利、最能發揮滿足人們慾望的效果，乃是身為「經濟人」的萬物之靈所努力的目標。本課程提供學習者分析經濟現象的工具，掌握經濟發展的脈動，以便在現代經濟社會中立於不敗之地。
description.en: In human society economic activity is getting more and more complicated and economic relationship between people is also getting more and more complicated but all are to seek for the solution of economic problems. Among a number feasible ways how to choose the best way that can make best use of limited resources to satisfy people's desire shall be the goal for human being as "economic persons" making effort to fulfill. The course enables students to learn the tools for the analysis of economic situation, the way of grasping the wave of economic development in Taiwan so as to win in the modern economic society.

description.zh: 以視覺藝術為探討重點，研究藝術起源以及原始美術、民俗與大眾藝術分野。探究式覺元素和設計原理以及應用媒材、使用技巧，涵蓋素描、水彩、油畫、版畫、混合媒材、雕塑、建築，廣告、包裝、服裝設計、工業產品設計及攝影等。配合幻燈教學，使同學對於視覺藝術有整體性、概括性的認識，以奠定將來從事藝術鑑賞和研究創造之基礎。
description.en: The focus of this course is the exploration of visual arts.  Students will study the origin of art and the distinction among primitive art, folk and popular art. This course also provides students with visual elements, design principles, applied media material, and techniques including charcoal drawing, water-colored painting, oil painting, graphic art, compound material, sculpture, architecture, advertisement, packaging, fashion design, industrial design, and photography. Slide teaching is adopted to give students a comprehensive and general understanding on visual art in order to foster students to appreciate, study, and create art.

description.zh: 本課程旨在培養學生成為具有深度文化視覺的科技人。從認識本土文化為起點，進而認識世界文化。引導學生如何探究文化現象，並且深入文化的精神境界，物質境界，瞭解文化價值與文化傳統，讓文化觀點充分融入個人的思維內涵。
description.en: The main purpose of this course is to develop the cultural cultivation of our technology majored students. Starting with the culture of our own land and extending to world-wide culture. The teachers would guide the students to explore the phenomena of the culture, and try to find out both the spirit and the material of the culture. Through the understanding of the worth and the tradition of the culture, the students might merge the cultural cultivation into their personal thinking.

description.zh: 永續發展是妥善規劃與管理自然資源之最高指導原則，因此本課程依此宗旨討論土壤管理、有害物質處理與處置、水及廢水處理與管理；更將以實際例將面向擴及科技與社經整合層次，以期落實理論於實際應用之中。
description.en: This is intented as a brief introduction to the subject of the substainable development of natural resource. Main subject are soil management, hazardous waste treatment and disposal and water and wastewater treatment and management. Many overall regional case studies will be discussed. It must be technologic, economic and social environmental change or a new factural data are developed

description.zh: 本課程著重在協助企業如何在國際間綠色浪潮的衝擊與永續發展三重盈餘之二十一世紀新經濟中競存，並能與全球永續發展的理想共存共榮。換言之，本課程主要是協助企業如何透過環境的議題，將原本可能的威脅課程轉換成機會。課程內容包括：企業環境管理與永續發展的內涵、企業環境風險管理與預防、整合性企業環境管理的做法、綠色行銷與永續消費、綠色產品設計、環境會計、環境資訊的揭露與報告、企業社會責任的內涵及做法，以及其他企業綠化的做法。
description.en: This course focuses on strategically assisting enterprises to improve their competitiveness through environmental issues while striving for sustainability in the 21st century. The contents of the course will be covering overview of corporate environmental management and sustainable development, corporate environmental risk management and prevention, green accounting, green marking and sustainable consumption, corporate social responsibility, corporate environmental disclosure and reporting, and some other subjects related to the greening of the business.

description.zh: 能源在日常生活中以很多型態呈現，大量的能源使用於汽車動力、食物與用水加熱、產品製造、發電及其他不同事務。使用傳統能源會排放空氣污染物，因而引起鄰近地區、區域、跨國境空氣污染問題，甚至是全球的環境衝擊效應。本課程將檢視能源使用現況及其衍生的環境議題，並且探討能源使用之趨勢。傳統能源(如煤、石油、天然氣、核能等)、及再生能源(如太陽能、水力、風能、地熱能等)及能源效率等內容，都將於課程中介紹
description.en: Energy enters our everyday lives in many ways. Prodigious amounts of energy are used to power automobiles, heat food and water, manufacture products, generate electricity, and perform various other tasks. The use of traditional energy will emit air pollutants that may result in regional air pollution problem as well as global effects. In this course we will look at the current energy situation, its environmental implications, and try to determine the patterns of energy use. We will look at energy use as coal, petroleum, natural gas, nuclear energy, and renewable energy, such as solar energy, hydroelectric

description.zh: 提供本校四技學生在本行以外，對其他領域的認識，以彌補其只鑽研專業課程的偏頗，訓練學生整合知識，使不致在知識爆炸的時代中迷失，促進各種專材的溝通，培養共識；培育人文素養，啟發人文關懷，使具有完整的人生觀。
description.en: This course offers a good opportunity for four-year college students in this university to have an easier access to a completely different field of knowledge, in the hope that  students can add their individual professional knowledge and broaden their minds. The students will be furnished with integrated knowledge, discovering a better way towards professional communication, developing more common sense and never losing themselves in this information-explosive age. With a solid basis on humanity and liberal ideology, they are sure to find a more complete picture of human life.

notes: 請選讀進修學院的通識課程

description.zh: 從設計產業經營之立足點探討經典服務理論如：服務品質、服務設計與服務體驗工程（S.E.E.）之應用與實踐。授課內容側重於基礎服務理論與最新服務科學方法的介紹，並選擇特定服務產業進行實務研習對象。課程預計以主題講授、專家座談、分組研習方式進行，並分三期評量服務研習成果。
description.en: The course aims at the training of applying prominent service theories and methods such as Service Quality, Service Design, Service Experience Engineering (S.E.E.) to the management of design service. It proceeds in the forms of topics lecturing, professional speeches and groups study. The result of study is evaluated in three stages accordingly.

description.zh: 本課程介紹產品介面設計之系統性實務。產品介面設計面臨使用者多樣化與介面日趨複雜的挑戰，設計者必須憑藉精確的方法才能掌握設計的易用性。各種方法包括：使用者需求探討、使用性分析、解決方案評估、實驗模型製作、使用者測試等。其中使用性測試係模擬介面與使用情境，藉由觀察與記錄挖掘操作過程之經驗，其中包括操作錯誤、使用疑惑、使用挫折、使用效率與使用滿意度。本課程將介紹上述各種方法及理論，並以案例引導學習者思考與操作。
description.en: This course is to introduce a practical and systematic way to deliver a product that works for users. It is a methodical approach involves several methods, including gathering requirements, analyzing usability problems, evaluating design alternatives, proposing solutions, developing and testing prototypes, and testing a interface with users. The goal of usability testing is to uncover problems that users may encounter so those problems can be fixed. Testing may include collecting data on the paths users take to do tasks, the errors they make, when and where they are confused or frustrated, how fast they do a task, whether they succeed in doing the task, and how satisfied they are with the experience. Case studies and practice will be carried out with illustration and discussions.

description.zh: 認知記號, 產品語意, 生活環境相關課題, 以科技整合, 人因互動, 研究方法為重點, 以跨領域整合, 國際合作, 模擬驗證為特色之研  究.
description.en: This course provides study of design-ergonomics related topics on Cognitive Semiotics and Product Semantics. With emphasis on technology integration, ergonomics proactive and methodology, the course will be characterized by inter-disciplinary and international cooperation and simulation verification.

description.zh: 本課程的目的是協助研究生準備進行有關設計創造力開發、創意設計手法與設計方法論等主題之碩士論文研究或實務專題設計，提供各種理論工具與個案演練。課程內容包括(1)人工智慧、心理學、人類學和語言學等導向之設計創造力研究，以及(2)規則式與案例式推理、基模類比與聯想、產品俗民誌、模式語言和體驗劇本等創意設計手法演練。
description.en: The objective of this course is to help the graduate students whose topics of master's theses or graduate projects are related to creativity development, creative design skills and methodology, to prepare their preliminary studies. This course provides the necessary theoretical tools and case studies, and its contents contain (1) design creativity research based on artificial intelligence, psychology, anthropology and linguistics, as well as (2) exercises of creative design techniques: rule-based reasoning and case-based reasoning, schematic analogy and association, product ethnography, pattern language and experiential scenario.

name.zh: 電腦整合設計與製造研究
name.en: Study of Computer Integrated Design and Manufacturing

description.zh: 本課程旨在介紹研究電腦整合設計與製造之軟體，並藉實例演練，以達熟悉研究電腦整合設計與製造之操作與功能。
description.en: To introduce and study the software of computer integrated design and manufacturing.  By the project practice, to be adept at the operation and function of computer integrated design and manufacturing.

description.zh: 本科目主旨在於加強學生使用語言的表達能力、並促使學生更加容易瞭解學術論文。每週的課程是由一系列連貫性的論文來引導學生去學習即分析論文，並能以口語、寫作正確地表達出所分析論文的含義。這些所提供的研究論文都具備可精闢分析的要素。這些文章的內容有包含習慣的不同、事件的相對面、意見的分歧、喜好的差異、演繹法即歸納法得的結論等等。
description.en: This course aims to enhance oral and written communication skills and in the process provide a greater understanding of the philosophy underlying academic discourse. Weekly units are oriented around a progressive series of tasks which consider academic texts in context and require learners to understand, analyse and produce spoken and written texts appropriate to the context of academic English. The contextualisation of these tasks is the philosophical aspects of critical analysis. Themes, such as the difference between convention, fact, opinion and preference; deductive and inductive proof; validity and truth; evidence; and the ethics of persuasion, are the basis on which the skills are taught.

description.zh: 此課程係提供對不織布學之研究與理論有興趣的研究生。課程包括所有不織布製造方法與其在工業領域上之應用，包括有短纖維網、長絲網、濕式纖維網之製造方法；纖維網之物理強化方法，纖維網之化學強化方法；不織布、薄膜、梭織物與針織物之疊層方法；微細與超微細粒子在不織布上之應用；不織布之印染與整理加工；不織布在電子、航太、醫學材料及人工皮革上之應用。
description.en: This program is designed for graduate students who are interested in research and theoretical aspects of Non-woven materials. The course covers all aspects of Non-woven manufacturing methods, as well as their applications in industry. They include manufacturing methods of; fibrous web filament web wet method; physically bonded, chemically bonded or methods; lamination among the film, woven, knitted and Non-woven fabrics; use of fine and superfine particle in Non-woven industry; Printing and Finishing for Non-woven; use of Non-woven in electronics aerospace, medical materials and artificial leather..…etc.

description.zh: 闡述可靠性工程基本理論與數學並結合電子系統可靠性設計方法，包括四個單元如下：（１） 可靠性基本理論與數學（２） 電子系統可靠性設計實務：電路簡，化電子零件選用與篩選， 降額設計，瞬態抑制與保護電路，電磁相容設計，熱與振動設       計，餘裕（３） 可靠性分析方法：可靠性模式與預估，失效模式。效應與關鍵       性分析，故障樹分析（４） 可靠性試驗：環境應力篩選，可靠性成長與鑑定試驗，加速壽       命試驗。
description.en: Discussed the basic concept and mathematical of reliability engineering associated with comprehensive methodolgy of electronic system reliability design practices. These topics are grouped into four parts as follow :1.Devoted to the basic theory and mathematical of reliability   engineering. 2.Deal with electronic system reliability design practices :   Circuit simplification , parts selection and application ,   Hi-Rel parts screening , Derating , Transients suppression   and protection circuits , EMC design , Thermal and   vibration design , and Redundancy. 3.Dosvusses the reliability analysis methods : Reliability   modeling and prediction , Failure mode、effects and   criticality analysis (FMECA) , and Fault tree analysis   (FTA). 4.Dedicated to reliability testing : Environmental streess   screening (ESS) , Reliability growth test , Reliability   qualification test , and Accelerated life test.

description.en: The lab course is designed for supplementing the lecture course'Communication Systems' and 'Digital Communication Systems'.sStudents can learn the principles and practive of analog and digital communication systems from laboratory experiments and projects.The cintents include1.measuremnts of signals in time domain and frequency domain 2.design of analog filters3.double sideband AM systems4.single sideband AM systems5.FM systems6.dessign of phase-locked-loop detectors7.sampling and regeneration of analog signals8.pulse amplitude modulation(PAM)systems9.pulse coded modulation(PCM)systems10.digital passband transmission11.multiplexing systems12.design and simulation of communication systems

name.zh: 積體電路佈局設計實務
name.en: Integrated Circuit Layout Design and Implementation

description.zh: 本課程在訓練學生如何使用電腦輔助設計軟體來設計積體電路佈局,進而能培養學生具有設計積體電路佈局的能力,課程內容包含：1.佈局與電路的差異2.CMOS佈局的介紹3.電阻、電容的佈局介紹4.類比電路單元的佈局5.類比電路佈局的規劃6.輸入/輸出焊墊的介紹7.電感的佈局8.射頻電路的佈局9.電流鏡的佈局10.鎖相迴路的佈局11.雙級運算放大器的佈局12.交換電容分器的佈局13.低雜訊放大器的佈局14.數位類比轉換的佈局15.類比數位轉換器的佈局
description.en: This course is trained the student to use computer-aided design tools for the design of integrated circuit layout. Therefore, the student has the design capability of integratd circuit layout. The contedts of this course:1.Differences between layout and circuit 2.CMOS layout style 3.R、C layout.4.Analog cell layout 5.Analog floor plan 6.I/O pad layout issue 7.L Layout 8.RF circuit layout 9.Current mirror layout 10.PLL layout 11.Two stage OPA layout 12.Switched capacitor integrator layout 13.LNA layout 14.D/A layout 15.A/D layout

description.zh: 瞭解程式語言所常用之各種資結構，１.抽象資料類別及運算複雜度之概念，２.靜態結構及其儲存法，３.遞迴、堆疊、前序、中序、後序運算式，４.佇列，５.串列、鏈結串列，６.樹、二元樹、平衡樹、堆積，７.圖形，８.排序，９.搜尋、雜湊。
description.en: This course is mainly aimed at introducing the data  structures commonly used in programming languages, including: (1) the concept of ADT (abstract data type) and computational complexity, (2) static structures and their storage representations , (3) recursion, stacks, and prefix, infix, and posfix expressions, (4) queues, (5) lists and linked lists, (6) trees, binary trees, height balanced trees, and heaps,  (7) graphs, (8) soring, and (9) searching and hashing.

name.en: Foundution Construction Disaster and Remedial Measures

description.zh: 基礎開挖施工作業的災害最主要的是擋土牆的傾倒,這是源自於隆起、砂湧及管湧的現象。開挖區的土壤為砂土,如果擋土牆漏水,由於淘空所形成的管湧,會導致鄰房的損壞;由於擋土牆貫入深度的不足以及點井措施的不良,會造成開挖區的砂源,最終導致擋土牆的傾倒。開挖區的土壤如果為粘土,而且粘土含水量大於液限,則開挖區的粘土產生塑性液,使支撐系統挫屈破壞,最後造成擋土牆的破壞。這些原理皆為課程的內容。此外,當基礎施工災害的機制了解之後,再講授如果發現災害的徵兆,如何採取必要的緊急應變措施, 使災害消失於無形,這些應變措施分別按照技術及行政層面來敘述。
description.en: 英文名稱:Foundution Construction Disaster and Remedial Measures  The hazand during foundation excavation is retaining wall failure, this may be caused by heaving、boiling and piping。If excavation is conducted in granular soil in which retaining wall is found leaking, the migration of silty soil will trigger piping and eventually wall failure。 If excave embedded depth of retaining wall and point walls are insufficient, this can cause boiling and lead to wall failure。 If encavation is in cohesive soil and water content is higher than liquid limit, plastic flow will lead to huckling of bracing system and to the wall failure。 After the various failure mechanisms are explained, how to identify the symptoms and how to take urgent remedial measures both technology and administration are explained accordingly。

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意。曲軸沖床、各單元件之設計與構造要點、剪斷原理與過程、變形原理、成形現象、引伸原理、力的分析、設計實例、連續引伸的設計程序。
description.en: Structure and design Fundamental element of craft, punching, principle and process of steaming cutting, principles of deformation, forming phenomena, design and manufacturing process of continuous stretching.

description.zh: 本課程採用分組教學，以1：5的師生比例就教師之專長指導學生在建築實務工作之各領域進行資料搜集，現場觀摩，對特定之課題提出報告，訓練學生深入的接觸並膫解實際的工作，以培養學生發掘問題，解決問題之執業能力。
description.en: There are teaching groups for this course, each teacher by his particular research field direct five students in special topics on Architecture practice for information collecting, site studying, and report writing, The purpose is training students to come into conduct with reality Architecture working. Then, footer students professional ability to find problems, and resolve there problems in working field.

name.zh: 第二語言習得專題討論

description.zh: 本課程將對第二語言習得的主要議題進行深入地探討論與分析。上課的內容包括，但不限於，下列主題: 語言天賦、跨語言影響、人格特質、學習動機、學習風格、學習策略、外語焦慮和外語學習信念等。
description.en: This course is designed to engage students in intensive study and analysis of selected issues and problems in second language acquisition. The topics covered in this course include, but are not limited to, the following: language aptitude, cross-linguistic influences, personality, motivation, leaning styles, learning strategies, language anxiety, and learners' beliefs.

description.zh: 本課程在介紹及闡述化學原理及物質之性質，著重於現代化學理論及概念之導入。內容包括氣體、計量化學、原子結構、化學鍵、物質狀態、能量轉換、酸鹼理論、氧化還原反應、金屬及非金屬元素、核化學。
description.en: Introduction to the principles of chemistry and properties of matter, which are explained in terms of modern chemical theory with emphasis on conceptual problems. Individual topics include gas, stoichiometry, atomic structure, chemical bonding, and the states of matter, energy relation, acid-base theory and oxidation-reduction reactions, the chemistry of metallic and nonmetallic elements, nuclear chemistry.

description.zh: 本課程的目標在使學生了解工業安全衛生的重要,熟悉有關知識及緊急措施,從而增加處變之因應能力.內容包括工業安全衛生組織,事故調查分析,工廠設備安全要領,工業衛生和衛生設備.
description.en: This course is design to introduce the student to concept of the importance of industrial safety and health with emphasis on the ability of dealing with accidents. Topics covered are organization of industrial safety , analysis of Accident ,industrial health and facilities.

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意。  數位系統簡介，數字系統及編碼，基本邏輯操作，數位積體電路設計，布氏代數與卡諾圖，組合電路設計與應用，正反器，暫存器，順序電路設計與應用，計數器與計時器，多工器與解多工器，記憶體，微處理機架構簡介。
description.en: Introduction to Digital Circuits, Digital Systems and Coding, Basic Logic Operations,  Boolean Algebra and K-Map, Combinational Logic Circuits, Flip-Flop, Register, Sequential Circuit Design and Applications, Counter  and Timer, Multiplexer and Demultiplexer, Shit Register and Memory, Introduction to Micro-processor.

description.zh: 先修課程：電子軟體系統或相當之課程數位訊號處理簡介，DSP架構與控制器硬體簡介，計時器、輸入捕捉、輸出比較，波寬調變，類比訊號轉換週邊功能與通訊架構介紹，DSP訊號處理與控制應用。
description.en: Introduction to Digital Signal Processors, DSP architecture and integration with microcontroller, applications of DSP peripherals and communication protocols, applications of DSP to control and signal processes.

description.zh: 課程大綱規劃主要依據上述的四部份分別進行授課，包含固態氧化物燃料電池之原理應用及檢測、潔淨能源技術、變頻式高效率交流液體技術與生質能及敏化染料太陽能技術，分別敘述如下：  1.潔淨能源技術能源概論，非再生能源與再生能源的利用能源的有效變換，未來能源的  發展形態有效能源之解析與評估，能源效率之管理。本課程主要是探討燃料電池的製程技術與發展。   a. 燃料電池製程技術介紹(Introduction)    b. 電池效率與開路電壓(Efficiency and Open Circuit Voltage)    c. 操作燃料與電壓(Operational Fuel and Voltage)    d. 中子交換薄膜燃料電池(Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cells)    e. 鹼性電解質燃料電池(Alkaline Electrolyte Fuel Cells)    f. 甲烷燃料電池(Direct Methanol Fuel Cells)    g. 中溫與高溫燃料電池(Medium and High Temperature Fuel Cells)   h. 燃料電池之燃料添加(Fuelling Fuel Cells)    i. 壓縮機、透平機、葉扇與?浦(Compressors, Turbines, Ejectors, Fans,   Blowers, and Pumps)    j. 燃料電池之動力輸送(Delivering Fuel Cell Power)    k. 燃料電池之系統分析(Fuel Cell Systems Analyzed)
description.en: This course clean energy covers the fundamentals and applications of fuel cell, solar cell and biomass energy. The fundamentals are introductory of the energy source principle and transfer mechanism of fuel cell, solar cell and biomass energy. The design and production technologies of the clean energy are introduced and discussed. The examples or other topics of clean energy applications and procedures as well as specifications of the testing are usually regardant in this introductory course.

description.zh: 先修課程：負責教授同意。半導體元件、整流電路、電晶體和電路、運算放大器、線性積體電路、邏輯元件、數位電路、數位積體電路、微處理器、放大器等。
description.en: Semiconduction Device, Rectifier circuit, Transistor Circuit, Operational Amplifier, Linear Integrated Circuit, logic Device, Digital Circuit, Digital Integrated Circuit, Micro Processor, Amplifier, etc.

description.zh: 1.簡介，2.個人電腦（PC-486）之界面，3. 視窗作業系統，Visual Basic 及Borland C++ 3.1 語言，4.視窗應用界面(API)，動態脫結程式庫 (DLL)，動態資料交換 (DDE) 及物件連結崁入(OLE) 基本程式設計，5.客戶應用程式及服務者應用程式的架構設計，6.多媒體，影像壓縮和運動，7.簡介人工智慧，專家系統，Fuzzy 及 Neural 網路，8.圖形監控系統：A. IODDE, B. NETDDE, C. 物件導向圖控, D. 分散式控制網路，9.論文研討。
description.en: 1.introduction to personal computer interface.2.Windows operation system : V.B.or VC++.3.Program design for Dynamic link library (DLL).4.Program design for Dynamic Data exchange (DEE).5.Device Driver writing for windows :I.O.DDEand NETDDE.6.Multi-media and Virtual Reality Internet.7.Introduction to A.I.and Fuzzy-Neural Network .8.Object-Qriented graphic control user interface.

description.zh: 先修課程：指導教授同意本課程利用要徑法教導學生管理一項專案有關時間及成本的估計，進度表，預算編列等技巧，及其它監督控制一項專案進行之措施。專案經理在一家公司組織內的地位和角色亦將加以討論。課程內容包含：（1）專案的定義和辨認，（2）專案可行性研究和選擇條件，（3）專案進度表編排，（4）專案之預算與成本控制，（5）限制性資源之編排與調配，（6）專案評核與檢討技巧。
description.en: This course introduces the technique of Critical Path Method (CPM) to manage a project in terms of time / cost estimation, scheduling, budgeting, and other control / monitoring measures on the performance of a project. The role of project manager in an organization will also be discussed. Topics to be covered are: (1) Concept and identification of a project, (2) Project feasibility study and selection criteria, (3) Project scheduling, (4) Budgeting and cost control, (5) Constrained resource scheduling and leveling, and (6) Project evaluation and review technique.

name.en: Special topics of modern manufacturing technology

description.zh: 介紹最新製造技術中的特殊項目，包括：1、製造實驗及統計分析2、製造設備，強調電腦化的運動控制及製程控制3、電腦化的製造系統，如CAD、CAM、CIM、LAN及因電腦化產生的系統進化。
description.en: Introducing special topics of newest manufacturing technology. Including:1.Manufacturing experiments and statistical evaluation.2.Manufacturing equipment, emphasizing on computerized motion control and process control.3.Computerized manufacturing system, like CAD, CAM, CIM, LAN, and manufacturing system 's evolution due to computerization.

description.zh: 全球化製造體系的形成，使得合約製造商必須以更積極的態度，從策略面出發，藉由各種電腦與網路的技術，整合內部與外部的流程與資訊，打造數位化工廠。數位化製造的目的，是希望藉由資訊透明化，提升整個製造體系的競爭優勢。課程的設計，是以概念介紹的方式，說明數位製造的應用現況與相關技術。本課程的內容包括：數位化製造概論、數位化製造實例說明、商業模型分析、知識管理、企業知識入口網站、產品資料管理、交易系統、資料倉儲、企業資訊入口網站、工作流程管理、最新數位化相關技術介紹。
description.en: Globalization has lead contract manufactures more active on seeking new strategies to survive. To increase competition, new technologies, such as computer and network technology, have applied. Computer and network technology can integrate internal and external information to establish a so-called "e-factory." This course covers different issues related to e-Manufacturing, such as Concept of e-Manufacturing, Case Study, Business Model Analysis, Knowledge Management, Enterprise Knowledge Portal (EKP), Product Data Management (PDM), Concept of Trading Systems, Concept of Data Warehousing, Enterprise Information Portal (EIP), Workflow Management, State of the Art Technologies, etc.

description.zh: 本課程著重在奈米材料的合成以及鑑定，包含氣相反應以及溶液相反應。課程核心內容為：(1)各式溶液相合成奈米粉末、中空奈米球以及奈米線(2)氣相反應合成奈米管、奈米線(3)分子轉印技術(4)奈米材料檢測技術
description.en: This course will cover the syntheses and characterization of various nanomaterials. The core lectures include:1. syntheses of nanoparticles, hollow nanospheres and nanowires from solutions2. syntheses of nanowires and nanotubes from the gas phase3. molecular imprinting4. characterization and properties of nanomaterials
